description:
25 Games For Your TRS-80 Model 100 is a collection of 25 games written in BASIC.

  • Art Auction: Buy and sell art for profit
  • Avarice: Roll dice to accumulate money
  • Bettor Draw: Guess the next card in a 52 card deck
  • Bingo: The program calls out numbers for a Bingo game
  • Bowling: The player rolls a ball down the bowling alley to try to knock down pins
  • Candy Store: Set prices operating a candy store to profit over 5 turns
  • Codebreaker: Try to deduce a code using hints
  • Computer Magi: A simple game of deception
  • Craps: Dice game
  • Duchy: Hammurabi clone
  • Invisible Maze: Navigate a maze with invisible
  • Memory Stretcher: Try to remember a randomized sentence briefly displayed on the screen
  • Paper, Rock, Scissors: Compete against the computer
  • Phrase Guess: Hangman game
  • Reflex: The player quickly responds to a screen prompt
  • Road Rally: Race a car on a road avoiding the sides
  • Scramble: Cryptogram puzzle game
  • Sketch: Draw a picture on the screen
  • Skydiver: Try to drop a parachutist on a landing pad
  • Slot Machine: Place bets on a spinning slot machine
  • Star Void: Travel 1000 parsecs with a fleet of 50 fighters in as few turns as possible
  • Stock Market: Buy low sell high on a number of stocks
  • Swami: The computer tries to guess the word the player is thinking
  • Swap: Trade objects between characters to reach desired product
  • Worm Hole: Avoid objects with a worm with a continuously extending tail
title: 25 Games For Your TRS-80 Model 100

description:
Starblaze 100 is a side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 Model 100.

The player controls a small ship that can move in all directions and fires laterally left and right. The player can travel to seven different planets via a transporter, with the goal of destroying the aliens on each planet. Each of the three starting ships has limited shields, and is destroyed after taking several hits. This shielding can be restored by docking with the transporter. If any planet accumulates 22 aliens, then it can be taken over and the transporter is destroyed, possibly stranding the player on that planet. The player receives 15 points for each alien destroyed, and 50 points for destroying a mothership.
title: Starblaze 100

description: Mol is a demake of Baldur's Gate III's first act. Due to the limitations of the system, only four party members are available (Karlach, Shadowheart, Gale, and Lae'zel) and the turn-based gameplay is reminiscent of the early Final Fantasy games.
title: Mol
